subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Archie Manning succeeded Ron Johnson yesterday as chairman of the National Football Foundation and College Football Hall of Fame. Manning, an All-America quarterback at Mississippi, was inducted into the Hall in 1989. He played 14 seasons in the N.F.L., and his sons Peyton and Eli are N.F.L. quarterbacks. Johnson, a running back, was inducted into the Hall in 1992. He played for Michigan and then seven seasons in the N.F.L.;Archie Manning succeeded Ron Johnson yesterday as chairman of the National Football Foundation and College Football Hall of Fame. Manning, an All-America quarterback at Mississippi, was inducted into the Hall in 1989. He played 14 seasons in the N.F.L., and his sons Peyton and Eli are N.F.L. quarterbacks. Johnson, a running back, was inducted into the Hall in 1992. He played for Michigan and then seven seasons in the N.F.L.
